results.title: King David
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Bruce Beresford, Martin Elfand and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Traces the life of the lowly shepherd boy who ascended to the throne of ancient Israel from his childhood battle with Goliath to his self-destructive passion for Bathsheba. Stars Richard Gere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Adam, Bruce Beresford, Martin Elfand and Paramount Pictures

results.title: King cotton
results.brief_description: A brief survey of the cotton industry in America together with illustrations of the various uses to which cotton is put in manufacture of automobiles. Compares the first cotton gin invented by Whitney with the modern machine. Shows modern methods of cotton production including the use of machinery on the cotton fields and dusting of crops from the air. Shows use of cotton for tyres, seat padding and the making of plastic fittings and cellulose.

results.title: King Arthur: his life and legends
results.creator_credit: Sue Hayes and A&E Television Networks
results.brief_description: The Arthur legend has all the tenets of a literary classic - tragedy, love, passion, war, adventure, bravery, chivalry, heroes, villains and mortals, which is probably why the world continues to be fascinated by this man created by fact, fiction and folklore. This program discusses the evolution of the legend from Geoffrey of Monmeith’s manuscript to the “Morte D’Arthur”, we follow the development of the Arthurian story and how history and the introduction of new characters altered the values behind the legend.

results.title: King and country
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey and B H E Productions
results.brief_description: Amidst the mud and blood of Passchendaele in 1917 Private Hamp awaits court martial for desertion. His crime? Simply walking away from the slaughter after three solid years at the front during which all his mates have been killed. Starring Dirk Bogarde, Tom Courtney and Leo McKern. According to Felix Barber of the Evening News, “This film is not only going to be regarded as one of the half-dozen greatest war films ever made; it is going into the select gallery of screen classics”.

results.title: Kindred spirits (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alan Fisk, Alan Burke and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Julie Nelson, a young dancer on the Sydney club circuit, witnesses the drowning of a young man and finds her life falling apart. It is a horrifying experience, but what is even more disturbing is that his presence continues to haunt her. The key to the mystery is held and withheld by an eccentric old lady.

results.title: Kindred
results.creator_credit: Julie Money, Television and Radio School and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A sensitive drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest. The film is gripping in its portrayal of the helplessness experienced by members of a family confronting the reality of incest. Cast, Alyson Best, Russell Newman, Melissa Jaffer, Julie, Tyler, Nick Holland, Susannah Fowle, Barbra Joss, Harold Kissin. Written by Debra Oswald.

results.title: Kindergarten
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A camera study of one day in the classroom with kindergarten children, illustrating how the teacher encourages the children to turn their curiosity into questions, and organized group activities and play periods. Filmed at Van Horne Public School, Montreal.

results.title: Kimono
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Iwanami Production
results.brief_description: This is the modern story of how, when and why the kimono is produced and worn - including wide variety designs, materials, and pattern basically remains the same for infants through to elderly.

results.title: Kimberley: land of the Wandjina
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit, Jeremy Hogarth and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Narrated by Leo McKern, this documentary, produced by the award-winning ABC TV Natural History Unit, explores the land and life of the spectacular Kimberley region of North West Australia. Aboriginal people believe that the Wandjina, the rain spirits, created the landscape. From the vast coastal mudflats to the tidal rivers and inland waterways, this beautifully photographed film explores in detail one of the least known regions of Australia.
